channel.title: Using a Linux System on SL Notebook
channel.description: Recent content in Using a Linux System on SL Notebook

item.title: Installing Software
item.description: Package managers The process of installing software on Linux can vary depending on the distribution you are using. Here is a general overview of the common methods used to install software on different Linux distributions: Debian and Ubuntu: Software is typically installed using the apt package manager. Low level manager is normally dpkg Red Hat and Fedora: Software is typically installed using the yum package manager. Low level manager is normally rpm SUSE Family: Software is typically installed using the zypper package manager.
